resource_fields.label: Name
resource_fields.help_text: Link to CKAN docs to follow

resource_fields.label: URL
resource_fields.help_text: URL where the specific resource can be accessed.

resource_fields.label: Hash (SHA256)
resource_fields.help_text: For file type resources, the SHA256 hash of file

dataset_fields.label: Map Number
dataset_fields.help_text:
The Map Number describes a single map product for an emergency.
* A map product may have multiple versions, each of which will have the same Map Number. To get an identifier for a specific version of a map use the `result.name` field.
* A Map Number is only unique within an emergency. To get an unique identifier across all emergencies use the [proposed] `parentID` field.

dataset_fields.label: Title
dataset_fields.help_text: Title of the map or dataproduct. Single line.

dataset_fields.label: Notes
dataset_fields.help_text: Summary or abstract describing the map. This is normally extracted from a text box on the map itself.

dataset_fields.label: Summary
dataset_fields.help_text: Summary or abstract describing the map. This is normally extracted from a text box on the map itself.

dataset_fields.label: Name
dataset_fields.help_text:
The version specific productID. 

This version of the product can be access via the Web UI as:
https://maps.mapaction.org/dataset/<productID>
and via the API as:
https://maps.mapaction.org/api/3/action/package_show?id=<productID>

dataset_fields.label: Data Source
dataset_fields.help_text: A description of the datasources used to produce this dataset.

dataset_fields.label: Glide Number
dataset_fields.help_text: This field can be a comma separated list of glidenos. This is because we do not always find that our operational responses match one-to-one with glidenos.

dataset_fields.label: Principal Country (ISO3)
dataset_fields.help_text: The ISO3 country for the principal disaster affected country

dataset_fields.label: All Countries (ISO3)
dataset_fields.help_text: A comma separated list of ISO3 country codes for all affected countries

dataset_fields.label: Language (ISO2)
dataset_fields.help_text: ISO 639-1 two letter code for the lanuage used in the product (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes)

dataset_fields.label: Language
dataset_fields.help_text: Natural language(s) used within the map or dataproduct

dataset_fields.label: Create Date
dataset_fields.help_text:
This is the timestamp that the map/dataset was produced. This may have been in an offline environment. 
This is the timestamp that will be shown on the map itself. ISO 8601 timestamp.

dataset_fields.label: Create Time
dataset_fields.help_text: This is the date and time that the map was produced. Typically it is the date and time that appear in the marginalia of the map itself.

dataset_fields.label: ReliefWeb Theme ID hint
dataset_fields.help_text: The ID of the ReliefWeb theme, which the MapAction field team presume is appropriate for the map. This is provided exclusively for the convenience of the ReliefWeb editorial team. Note that the ReliefWeb editorial team, may choose to override this value, hence it may not reflect the actual value used by ReliefWeb, if and when they republish this map.

dataset_fields.label: Vulnerable People
dataset_fields.help_text: Contains the ID of terms used by ReliefWeb to label content according to vulnerable groups such as Aged Persons, Children, IDPs, Persons with Disabilities, Refugees, and Women. See here for further details https://reliefweb.int/taxonomy-descriptions#groups

dataset_fields.label: Product Themes
dataset_fields.help_text: A list of zero or more humanitarian themes to which the product relates.

dataset_fields.label: X max
dataset_fields.help_text: Eastern edge of bounding box for the dataset, Given in Decimal Degrees, WGS1984. Used for GeoRSS <georss:box> element

dataset_fields.label: X min
dataset_fields.help_text: Western edge of bounding box for the dataset, Given in Decimal Degrees, WGS1984. Used for GeoRSS <georss:box> element

dataset_fields.label: Y max
dataset_fields.help_text: Northern edge of bounding box for the dataset, Given in Decimal Degrees, WGS1984. Used for GeoRSS <georss:box> element

dataset_fields.label: Y min
dataset_fields.help_text: Southern edge of bounding box for the dataset, Given in Decimal Degrees, WGS1984. Used for GeoRSS <georss:box> element

dataset_fields.label: Datum
dataset_fields.help_text: The datum used in the map

dataset_fields.label: Scale
dataset_fields.help_text: The nominal map scale, when printed at the size specified in "papersize"

dataset_fields.label: Access
dataset_fields.help_text:
Describes the intended audience for the product. Possible values:
* "Public"
* "MapAction"
* "Selected partners"

Note that this is not related to whether or not CKAN makes the dataset available publicly/anonymously or the legal licence for the data.

dataset_fields.label: License ID
dataset_fields.help_text: The ID of license group under which the map or dataproduct is published. License definitions and additional information can be found at http://opendefinition.org/

dataset_fields.label: Syndicate
dataset_fields.help_text: Indicates whether or not a dataset should be syndicated to HDX

dataset_fields.label: Data update frequency
dataset_fields.help_text: A verbal description of the expected frequency by which the underlying data is updated.

dataset_fields.label: Number of pages
dataset_fields.help_text: For multiple page products (eg atlases and powerpoint maps) this indicates the number of pages

dataset_fields.label: Paper size
dataset_fields.help_text: The papersize for which the map was optimised.

dataset_fields.label: JPG file name
dataset_fields.help_text: The filename of the first jpeg file (is one exists). Note that `resources.name` where resources.format=="JPEG" is more reliable.

dataset_fields.label: JPG file size
dataset_fields.help_text: Size in bytes, of the JPEG file (if it exists). The accuracy of this value is not guaranteed. It is known to be incorrect in the case of atlases.

dataset_fields.label: JPG resolution DPI
dataset_fields.help_text: The DPI used to produce the jpeg file (if one exists).

dataset_fields.label: PDF file name
dataset_fields.help_text: The filename of the main PDF file associated with the dataset.

dataset_fields.label: PDF file size
dataset_fields.help_text: Size in bytes, of the PDF file (if it exists). The accuracy of this value is not guaranteed. It is known to be incorrect in the case of atlases.

dataset_fields.label: PDF resolution DPI
dataset_fields.help_text: The DPI used to produce the pdf file (if one exists).

dataset_fields.label: KMZ file name
dataset_fields.help_text: The filename of the first KML file (is one exists). Note that `resources.name` where resources.format=="KML" is more reliable.

dataset_fields.label: KML resolution DPI
dataset_fields.help_text: The DPI used to produce any raster elements with the KMZ file (if one exists). Note that normally KMZ files are produced rather than KMLs despite the fieldname

dataset_fields.label: MXD file name
dataset_fields.help_text: The filename base (ie minus it's extension) of the map's source .mxd file (presuming it was produced in ArcGIS)

dataset_fields.label: Ref
dataset_fields.help_text: The filename base (ie minus it's extension) of the map's source .mxd file (presuming it was produced in ArcGIS)

dataset_fields.label: QC level
dataset_fields.help_text: Freetext description of the Quality Control process the map has been subjected to.

dataset_fields.label: Organization
dataset_fields.help_text:
An Organization object, describing MapAction.
Note that unlike most other CKAN instances, there is only ever one organisation object on MapAction's Map and Data Repository.
